pageTitle: Accessibility statement for Claim money back from Access to Work
h1: Accessibility statement for Claim money back from Access to Work

p1.text: This service is part of the wider GOV.UK website. There’s a separate
p1.urlText: accessibility statement for the main GOV.UK website.

p2.text: This page only contains information about the Claim money back from Access to Work service, available at

p3: This service is run by the Department of Work and Pensions (DWP). We want as many people as possible to be able to use this service. For example, that means you should be able to:

bulletPoints.pointOne: change colours, contrast levels and fonts
bulletPoints.pointTwo: zoom in up to 300% without the text spilling off the screen
bulletPoints.pointThree: get from the start of the service to the end using just a keyboard
bulletPoints.pointFour: get from the start of the service to the end using speech recognition software
bulletPoints.pointFive: listen to the service using a screen reader

p4: We've also made the text in the service as simple as possible to understand.

p5.text: has advice on making your device easier to use if you have a disability.

p7: Some people may find parts of this service difficult to use:

bulletPoints2.pointOne: Some users find the date and time input pages long and difficult to use and may miss the secondary buttons
bulletPoints2.pointTwo: Claim PDFs are not fully accessible to screen readers

p8: These are known issues that are being worked on.
p9: If you need information on this website in a different format like accessible PDF, large print, easy read, audio recording or braille:

pointOne.text: tell us you need information in a different format

p11: We’ll consider your request and get back to you as soon as possible.
h5: Reporting accessibility problems with this service

p12.text: We're always looking to improve the accessibility of this service. If you find any problems that are not listed on this page or think we're not meeting accessibility requirements, you can

p13.text: The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) is responsible for enforcing the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018 (the 'accessibility regulations'). If you're not happy with how we respond to your complaint,
p13.urlText: contact the Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS).

h7: Technical information about this service's accessibility
p14: The Department for Work and Pensions is committed to making this service accessible, in accordance with the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018.

p16: The service was last tested on 17 May 2023 and was checked for compliance with WCAG 2.1 AA. The tests were carried out by the Department for Work and Pensions. We tested a sample of pages that represent the implementation of each type of design pattern and interaction used in the service.
